thread.title: George Osborne: It would be a 'disaster' to stop building
thread.title_full: George Osborne: It would be a 'disaster' to stop building - BBC News

author: BBC
title: George Osborne: It would be a 'disaster' to stop building
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device
George Osborne: It would be a 'disaster' to stop building 5 October 2015 Last updated at 07:45 BST
Chancellor George Osborne has said it would be a "disaster" for the UK to stop building infrastructure projects.
The government has pledged to spend an extra Â£5bn on transport, energy and housing projects.
Mr Osborne was insistent the projects should be completed despite potentially affecting some people living in the locations proposed for new building.
He said he wanted a "cross-party" consensus so Parliament could come to "collective decisions".
